00025 #ifndef SEQUENTIAL_CLF_FILE_H
00026 #define SEQUENTIAL_CLF_FILE_H
00027 
00028 #include <assert.h>
00029 
00030 #include "TsvFile.h"
00031 #include "util/Convert.h"
00032 
00037 class SequentialClfFile
00038 {
00039 public:
00043   SequentialClfFile (void)
00044     : m_Rows (0), m_Cols (0)
00045   {}
00046 
00053   bool isSequential (affx::TsvFile& clfTsv)
00054   {
00055     std::string rowsValue, colsValue, sequentialValue;
00056     clfTsv.headersFindNext ("rows", rowsValue);
00057     clfTsv.headersFindNext ("cols", colsValue);
00058     clfTsv.headersFindNext ("sequential", sequentialValue);
00059     // Require rows, cols, and a sequential value of 1.
00060     if (rowsValue.empty() || colsValue.empty() || sequentialValue != "1")
00061       return false;
00062     // Save rows, cols.
00063     m_Rows = Convert::toInt (rowsValue);
00064     m_Cols = Convert::toInt (colsValue);
00065     return true;
00066   }
00067 
00075   void getProbeCoordinates (const int probeId, int& x, int& y)
00076   {
00077     // Probe id is one based, x and y are zero based.
00078     const int id = probeId - 1;
00079     x = id % m_Rows;
00080     assert (m_Cols > 0);
00081     y = id / m_Cols;
00082   }
00083 
00084 private:
00086   unsigned int m_Rows;
00088   unsigned int m_Cols;
00089 };
00090 
00091 #endif /* SEQUENTIAL_CLF_FILE_H */
